Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the comparison of the Covid-19 outbreak in PNG to "seasonal flu" by downplaying the severity and impact of the virus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting data to back up the assertion that the Covid-19 outbreak in PNG is just the "seasonal flu."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Covid-19 vaccines are unsafe and being trialled on local residents without providing substantial evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the surge in Covid-19 infections in PNG, such as the possibility of the virus spreading undetected.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that vaccines, including the AstraZeneca vaccine, have undergone rigorous testing and have been deemed safe by regulatory bodies such as the Therapeutic Goods Administration.
Understate: The claim understates the potential side effects of the AstraZeneca vaccine by not acknowledging that they are normally mild to moderate and resolve within a few days.
Falters at times: The claim falters by suggesting that people should avoid hospitals and rely on home remedies, which may not be sufficient for treating severe cases of Covid-19.
